channel.title: Getting into the SYSTEM ACCOUNT with Windows XP
channel.description:
Most people haven't even heard of the system account. Its like the Admin's Admin.
Ok So
Open up CMD (Start>Run>cmd.exe)
Type [code]at HH:MM /interactive "cmd.exe"[/code] Dont type HH:MM though have your computer time + 1 minute so that "cmd.exe" will start in 1 minute! k?
Ok once its opened up the title should have svchost.exe in it. leave it and open up task manager. Go to the process' tab and end "explorer.exe"
Go back to svchost.exe and type "explorer.exe" without to quotes and thats you done!!!! Welcome to the SYSTEM account!! It has some stuff that the admins account dosent have.
If you get errors saying unrecognised command then...
Right click my computer> properties. Advanced tab> enviromental variables
At the System Variables part. Modify the path variable. and add on the end [code];C:\windows\;C:\windows\system32\[/code]
Please leave a reply!

item.title: Getting into the SYSTEM ACCOUNT with Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @raindropsc raindropsc
item.description:
@raindropsc wrote:

how can u change the admin’s pass? i got in to the SYSTEM account but when i click on the User Accounts button, it says User Account Not Reconized

Read full topic

item.title: Getting into the SYSTEM ACCOUNT with Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Yes, system accounts can also view your computer’s binary logs and restore points as far as I know.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting into the SYSTEM ACCOUNT with Windows XP

item.title: Getting into the SYSTEM ACCOUNT with Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Ok everyone, here is the difference between the system account and the administrator account. Only the system account can access a computer’s SAM files, (files that store all windows local user information - usernames and passwords) while you are actually logged into the computer. Usually you’d have to use a program like l0phtcrack or pwdump2 to get them while logged into an account other then the system account.

That’s the biggest thing with the system account, there are probably more, but I havn’t looked into it too much more then that.[br][size=1]Posted at: December 07, 2006, 08:55:59 PM[/size][hr]Oh, and keep in mind - all user logon information are stored in hashes, and windows xp versions after a certain update also have syskey encryption, making it even harder for programs like john the ripper and lc5/l0phtcrack to crack them.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“yakman, post:15, topic:20255”]this looks good!

im going to see if i can do this at school, thanks for the tut

by the way, what things can you do on SYSTEM that you cant with administator? i havent noticed anything new[/quote]

Well, i have been really looking for things, but one thing is you can delete or edit the admins password.

Oh yea it works in school aswell aslong as you can end explorer somehow and have acess to cmd, is you cant get a hold of task manager try and end the process some other way, like in a batch file.

item.description:

I got it to work. Maybe tell us what is different?

for those having trouble with timer, DON’T type 00:01 that will start at midnight, you start it your system time + 1, for me 21:17 when the time was 21:16.

item.title: Getting into the SYSTEM ACCOUNT with Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

Salemthegoodkitty:

Cool… i guess… it would be cooler if i understood it…

Its quite a simple tut if you followed it corrent it will work. Unless Your variables are fucked up.

flamed fury1:

At is not recognised as an internal or external command.

Ok your variables are fucked up.

Right click my computer> properties. Advanced tab> enviromental variables

At the System Variables part. Modify the path variable.
and add on the end “;C:windows;C:windowssystem32” without quotes.

Ill edit my original post and put this in it![br][size=1]Posted at: October 27, 2006, 09:07:38 PM[/size][hr][quote=“JukuG, post:4, topic:20255”]It’d be even cooler if you could like modify cool shit with the admins admin.[/quote]

Yeah well this works in school very well so…
